page.title: 11PISHIOBURY
page.content: Pishiobury Park covers two hundred and fifty acres and in it is the old house built from designs by James Wyatt.The house built beside a lake has a drive nearly a mile long and was the site of an old manor house .Inside some wall panelling and other fittings survive from the Elizabethan manor house built by Sir Walter Mildemay which was later burned down.Later Pishiobury was used as a School .Now they want to turn it into offices and build houses where the stables used to be .That will mean twice as many cars going up and down Pishiobury drive.Before they do all that they have to get a document signed by the council.I think it will spoil the countryside around the school.They can't build on Pishiobury because of the green belt.
